summary: This document is a subpoena issued by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney to the United States, commanding the production of documents from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP). It includes the subpoena form, instructions, and the full protocol of the EVCP as Attachment A. The subpoena seeks all materials related to accusers, including claim forms, communications, payments, and releases, for use in Maxwell's criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in criminal case 20CR330, for whom this subpoena is being requested by her defense attorney to obtain documents from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell who requested and is to be served with this subpoena; works at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C. in Denver, Colorado.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the perpetrator of sexual abuse whose estate established the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program to resolve claims of victims-survivors.

persons.name: Kenneth R. Feinberg
persons.context: Nationally recognized claims administration expert retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to help design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Camille S. Biros
persons.context: Nationally recognized claims administration expert retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to help design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Marci A. Hamilton
persons.context: A nationally recognized sexual abuse expert, legal academic, and victims' rights advocate who may be consulted by the Program Administrator to inform about abuse dynamics and serve as a resource, with claimant consent.

connections.description: Pagliuca is the defense attorney representing Maxwell in her criminal case, as indicated by his request for this subpoena on her behalf.
Maxwell is accused of assisting Epstein in misconduct, and the EVCP protocol notes individuals who assisted Epstein may participate if under duress from their own abuse.
Both are nationally recognized claims administration experts retained together by the Epstein Estate to design the compensation program.
Hamilton may be consulted by the Program Administrator (Feinberg) to provide expert advice on sexual abuse dynamics and victim sensitivities.
Feinberg was retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to design and administer the victim compensation program.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance for EVCP Documents
events.description: A subpoena is issued by the defense for Ghislaine Maxwell, commanding the United States to produce all documents from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program for her criminal case.

events.title: Epstein Victims' Compensation Program Protocol Established
events.description: The protocol for the independent Epstein Victims' Compensation Program is finalized, outlining the process for victims-survivors to submit claims for sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: United States District Court, Southern District of New York, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007, Courtroom 318
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team subpoenaed the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program for all materials related to accusers, including claims, communications, payments, and releases.

The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program was an independent, voluntary program established by Epstein's estate, administered by Kenneth Feinberg and Camille Biros, to compensate victims-survivors of sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein.
The program protocol explicitly allowed individuals who had previously settled with Epstein or whose claims were time-barred by statutes of limitation to participate and seek compensation.
The program maintained strict confidentiality; information from claimants was not shared with the Epstein estate except for name, dates, and locations of alleged abuse for evaluation purposes.
The defense's subpoena seeks these confidential program materials, indicating an attempt to obtain information about accusers for Maxwell's criminal defense.
